    • Constructor Detail

      • Interpreter

        public Interpreter()
        Instantiates an interpreter and prepares it to parse expressions

      • Interpreter

        public Interpreter(Class<?>... extensions)
        Instantiates an interpreter, specifying a list of grammar extensions to load.

        Note: we must resort to this signature, rather than the natural Class<? extends GrammarExtension> ... that we would normally write. The reason is backwards compatibility with Java 1.6. Using Java > 1.6 would require us to add the @SafeVarargs annotation to prevent compile warnings, but this annotation does not exist in Java 1.6 and produces a compile error. Thus this is the only way to ensure warning- and error-free compilation in both situations.

        Parameters:
        extensions - The list of grammar extensions to load into the interpreter

      • Interpreter

        public Interpreter(Interpreter i)
        Instantiates an interpreter with the rules of another
        Parameters:
        i - The interpreter to borrow the rules form

      • getLastQuery

        public Object getLastQuery()
        Returns the result of the last call to the interpreter. This is either a processor, a user definition, or null if the interpreter failed, depending on the query.
        Returns:
        The result of the call
